prep: Shake in an iced cocktail shaker, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
name: 20th Century
Seven and Seven
prep: Pour whiskey into Collins glass filled with ice.  Fill to desired level with 7 Up. Stir lightly.
Recipes instruct to crush the ice until it is shaved and serve in champagne glasses with a leaf of hierba buena.
name: Agua de Sevilla
Adonis
prep: Combine ingredients with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a chilled glass. Garnish with an orange peel or twist.

name: Americano - Lo prendi nell'ano
garnish: half an orange slice, lemon twist
prep: Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into an old fashioned glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice and a lemon twist.

name: Angel Face
prep: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Appletini (aka apple martini)
caption: Top view of an apple martini
prep: Mix in a shaker, then pour into a chilled glass.  Garnish and serve.

name: Alexander
prep: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Astro pop
ingredients: sweet and sour mix and others
notes: Some versions are served as a [[cocktail]] or [[Shooter (mixed drink)|shooter]]

name: Aviation
caption: Aviation cocktail
prep: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
footnotes:
Some recipes include [[crème de violette]] or [[Creme Yvette]]. 
}}

name: B-52
prep: Layer ingredients into a shot glass.  Serve with a stirrer.

name: Bee's Knees
garnish: Optionally garnish with lemon or orange zest
prep: Stir honey syrup with lemon and orange juices until it dissolves, add gin and shake with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass

name: Bacardi Cocktail
prep: Shake together with ice.  Strain into glass and serve

name: Backdraft
prep: The preparation of this drink is complex, and is explained below.
notes: The cinnamon can be replaced with [[black pepper]] if desired, creating a much more bitter drink, known as the '''pepperdraft'''

name: Bellini
image: Bellini Cipriani, Macaroni Grill, Dunwoody GA.jpg
caption: Bellini Cipriani
prep: Pour peach purée into chilled glass, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.
notes: Traditionally a Bellini uses white peaches for the fruit.

name: Between the Sheets
prep: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Bijou Cocktail
prep: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain

name: Black Nail
caption: Black Nail
prep: Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes and then add the Irish whiskey and then Irish Mist. Stir gently.
notes: Traditionally a Black Nail uses blood red oranges for the fruit.

name: Black Russian
caption: A Black Russian cocktail
prep: Pour the ingredients into the old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Black Russian
caption: A Black Russian cocktail
prep: Pour the ingredients into the old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Black and Tan
caption: A blend of [[Guinness]] [[stout]] and [[Bass Brewery|Bass]] [[pale ale]]
ingredients: Pale ale or lager and stout or porter

name: Black Velvet
caption: A layered Black Velvet cocktail with the stout on the top
prep: Mix equal parts stout and Champagne

name: Blackthorn
prep: Fill mixing glass with gin, vermouth, and bitters. Add ice and stir until chilled, then add strain into a chilled glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.<ref>{{cite web|url

name: Bloody Mary
image: Bloody Mary Coctail with celery stalk - Evan Swigart.jpg
caption: A Bloody Mary garnished with celery served with [[ice cube]]s in a [[Highball glass]]
prep: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

name: Boulevardier
garnish: Orange zest, optionally a lemon zest
prep: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Blue Lagoon
image: Blue Lagoon at the Mandarin Oriental, Washington DC.jpg
caption: Blue Lagoon at the [[Mandarin Oriental, Washington, D.C.|Mandarin Oriental Washington]]
garnish: lemon slice or Garnish the brim with an orange slice

name: Brandy Alexander
prep: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Sprinkle with fresh ground nutmeg.

name: Bramble
prep: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the Crème de Mûre, shake well with ice, strain into chilled old fashioned glass filled with crushed ice, then pour the blackberry liqueur (Crème de Mûre) over the top of the drink, in a circular motion.

name: Bobby Burns
caption: A Bobby Burns cocktail
prep: Put all liquid ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Squeeze lemon peel on top. Stir, strain into glass.

name: Breakfast martini
ingredients: 3/4 shot (18.75 ml) Cointreau or triple sec
prep: Mix or shake in cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Strain into glass and serve.

name: Brass Monkey
prep: Stir together and serve over ice.

name: Bronx
prep: Pour into cocktail shaker all ingredients with ice cubes, shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail or martini glass.

name: Brooklyn
caption: Brooklyn cocktail
ingredients: 1/4 oz Picon or a few dashes of Angostura bitters
prep: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up.

name: Bushwacker
caption: homemade Bushwacker
prep: Blend all the ingredients together in a blender, including the ice, and then strain into a hurricane glass. Place cherry on top of the drink as a garnish and serve. Whipped cream can also be added as a garnish to the top of the drink before the cherry.<ref> {{cite web |url

name: Caesar
caption: Caesar made with 2 shots of vodka, a pinch of horseradish, a little spicy with 5 dashes of tabasco, made muddy with about 10 dashes of Worcestershire, all over ice, and filled to the top of a celery salt and spice rimmed glass with Clamato juice.
garnish: stalk of celery and wedge of lime
prep: Rim glass with celery salt, and a lime wedge.

name: Caipirinha
caption: Caipirinha
prep: Place lime and sugar into a double old fashioned glass and muddle gently. Fill the glass with cracked ice and add Cachaça. Stir gently to involve ingredients.
notes:
CAIPIROSKA – Instead of Cachaça use Vodka
}}

name: Caipiroska
prep: Squeeze juice from lime wedges into a highball glass. Place one of the lime wedges into the glass and add sugars. Muddle sugar with the lime wedges. Be careful not to overdo the muddling of the lime rind as it may make the drink too bitter. Pour in vodka and stir well until the sugar is dissolved. Add crushed ice and stir to melt some of the ice. Garnish with lime slice or wedge and serve.

name: Cape Codder
image: Cape Codder, Tommy Doyles Irish Pub, Hyannis MA.jpg
caption: Cape Codder
prep: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Carrot Cake
ingredients: one part Hot Damn Cinnamon Schnapps

name: Casino
caption: Casino
prep: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

name: Chicago Cocktail
prep: Shake or stir with ice.

name: Chimayó Cocktail
image: Chimayo Cocktail at Rancho de Chimayo, Chimayo NM.jpg
caption: Chimayó Cocktail at Rancho de [[Chimayo, New Mexico|Chimayó]]
prep: Pour the tequila and unfiltered apple cider into glass over ice.  Add the lemon juice and creme de cassis and stir.  Garnish and serve.

name: Cloister
prep: Combine ingredients with ice in cocktail shaker; shake well, then strain into cocktail glass, pouring over ice.
notes:
0.5 tsp of simple sugar solution or superfine sugar can added for a sweeter cocktail. The Cloister is normally made using dry gin. The cocktail can be served off the rocks, with no ice in the glass. This recipe, more suited to a larger cocktail glass, calls for:
*1.5 oz gin (6 parts)
*0.5 oz grapefruit juice (2.5 parts)
*0.25 oz lemon juice (1 part)
*0.5 oz yellow chartreuse (1 part)

name: Clover Club Cocktail
caption: A Clover Club Cocktail made with Gin, Lemon Juice, and Grenadine.
ingredients: 1 egg white or 20 ml aquafaba or 4 drops cocktail foamer
prep: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

name: Les Roysa
ingredients: 1 slice of each fresh orange, lemon and lime.
prep: In a mixing glass, mix sugar and fruit slices and press to juice fruit, add ice, guava juice and cachaça, mix again - pour into tall glass.
footnotes:
This cocktail was invented at Liberty Bar in Seattle, Washington in honor of Royce Gracie.
}}

name: Les Roysa
ingredients: 1 slice of each fresh orange, lemon and lime.
prep: In a mixing glass, mix sugar and fruit slices and press to juice fruit, add ice, guava juice and cachaça, mix again - pour into tall glass.
footnotes:
This cocktail was invented at Liberty Bar in Seattle, Washington in honor of Royce Gracie.
}}

name: Les Roysa
ingredients: 1 slice of each fresh orange, lemon and lime.
prep: In a mixing glass, mix sugar and fruit slices and press to juice fruit, add ice, guava juice and cachaça, mix again - pour into tall glass.
footnotes:
This cocktail was invented at Liberty Bar in Seattle, Washington in honor of Royce Gracie.
}}

name: Cojito
served: straight up in a cocktail glass
prep: In a shaker add white rum, Malibu, lime juice, some mint leaves and crushed ice, garnish with the sprig of mint.

name: Cooperstown Cocktail
prep: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass, add mint.

name: Cosmopolitan
caption: A cosmopolitan garnished with a lemon twist
prep: Shake all ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime slice.
notes: The drink should be a frothy bright pink color

name: Savoy Corpse Reviver
prep: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a glass.

name: Cremat
prep: Mix all ingredients in a pot, heat, then set aflame. Put out when about 1/3 of the drink has burned away. Serve hot in coffee mugs or glasses.
image: Cremaet al Centre Municipal de Pilota Valenciana de Borbotó.jpg|caption

name: Cuban Sunset
prep: Fill highball (tall) glass with ice. Mix lime soda, lemonade, guava nectar, and grenadine syrup together to form a mixture. Pour rum into glasses over ice, then evenly layer the guava mixture over the rum. Mix as desired. Garnish with a half-slice of lemon.

name: Daiquiri
caption: Classic Daiquiri served in a cocktail glass
prep: In a cocktail shaker add all ingredients. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Add ice and shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Damn the Weather
ingredients: 1/4 measure orange curacao or triple sec
prep: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

name: Derby
prep: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

name: El Presidente
garnish: twist of orange peel, optional cherry
prep: Stir well with ice, then strain into glass.  Garnish and serve.

name: Farnell
prep: Pour Jack Daniel's into Collins glass filled with ice.  Fill to desired level with lemonade.  Stir lightly and garnish with lime and mint.

name: Sloe gin fizz
prep: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

name: Fizzy Apple Cocktail
prep: Combine all three ingredients into a chilled glass and serve with ice and garnish.

name: Flaming Doctor Pepper
prep: Layer the two spirits in the shot glass, with the high-proof liquor on top.  Light the shot and allow it to burn; then extinguish it by dropping it into the beer glass. Drink immediately.

name: Flips
caption: A '''flip''' made from [[brandy]], an egg, and simple syrup is shown served in a stemmed cocktail glass and garnished with grated [[nutmeg]].
notes: See the article for specifics.

name: French 75
prep: Combine gin, syrup, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with champagne. Stir gently.

name: French Connection
prep: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Flaming volcano
caption: A "volcano bowl" flaming cocktail
garnish: pineapple and/or orange quarter slices, maraschino cherries

name: Gibson
prep: *Stir well in a shaker with ice, then strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish and serve

name: Gimlet
caption: A vodka gimlet with mint
prep: Mix and serve. Garnish with a slice of lime

name: Golden Dream
prep: Shake with cracked ice.  Strain into glass and serve.
notes:
Should be quite fluffy
}}

name: Gin and tonic
caption: Gin and tonic with lime wedge
served: Poured over cubes of ices ("on the rocks")
prep: In a glass filled with ice cubes, add gin and tonic.

name: Godmother
prep: Pour all ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

name: Hanky Panky
prep: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

name: Gunfire
prep: Pour the tea into a cup. Pour the rum in and stir.

name: Grasshopper
prep: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Herbsaint Frappé
ingredients: Half teaspoon simple syrup or sugar
prep: Stir together with plenty of ice, then strain into a very well chilled glass.  Serve very cold.
Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top.  Garnish and serve.

name: Greyhound
caption: Two greyhound cocktails
prep: Shake gin and grapefruit juice in cocktail shaker. Strain into a highball glass.

name: Horse's Neck
prep: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.
footnote:
IBA classifies this drink as a [[long drink]].
}}

name: Herbsaint Frappé
ingredients: Half teaspoon simple syrup or sugar
prep: Stir together with plenty of ice, then strain into a very well chilled glass.  Serve very cold.

name: Horsefeather
served: On the rocks; poured over ice

name: Hot buttered rum
caption: Hot buttered rum in a mug

name: Hugo
prep: Stir together over plenty of ice.

name: Hurricane
image: File:Made it to Pat O'Brien's for lunch and a hurricane.jpg
caption: A hurricane served in the typical glass at [[Pat O'Brien's Bar|Pat O'Brien's]], New Orleans
prep: Shake ingredients with ice, then pour into the glass and serve over ice.
notes: Some versions add orange juice, pineapple juice, and grenadine.  [[Fassionola]] is also sometimes used in place of the passion fruit syrup.

name: Jack Rose
prep: Traditionally shaken into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up.

name: Irish Car Bomb
caption: An Irish Car Bomb with [[Baileys Irish Cream]].
prep: The whiskey is floated on top of the Irish cream in a shot glass, and the shot glass is then dropped into the stout

name: Japanese Slipper
prep: Shake together in a mixer with ice.  Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

name: Jack and Coke
prep: Pour Jack Daniel's brand Tennessee whiskey into a Collins glass filled with ice. Fill to desired level with Coca-Cola. Stir lightly.

name: Wolfram
prep: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Jello shot
served: cold, set in a solid state
notes: Some versions are served a [[Shooter (mixed drink)|shooter]]

name: John Collins
ingredients: 3 cl (2 parts) freshly squeezed lemon juice
prep: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

name: John Daly
notes: A [[tongue-in-cheek]] reference to an [[Arnold Palmer (drink)|Arnold Palmer]] named after [[professional golfer]] [[John Daly (golfer)|John Daly]]

name: Jägerbomb
caption: A shot of Jägermeister dropped into a glass of Red Bull, creating a Jägerbomb

name: Karsk
prep: Heat the coffee; do not boil. Pour into cup and add the alcohol; serve hot.

name: Kamikaze
caption: Kamikaze cocktail, served straight up in a cocktail glass
prep: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

name: Kir royal
ingredients: 1 cl (0.33 ounce) (1 part) crème de cassis
prep: *Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up champagne.
notes: A recipe can be found at the [[International Bartenders Association]] website.

name: Kir
prep: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.
notes: A recipe can be found at the [[International Bartenders Association]] website.

name: Lemon Drop
caption: Lemon drop
prep: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with sugar rim around the glass.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
caption: The Long Island iced tea was named for its visual resemblance to non-alcoholic [[iced tea]].
prep: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Optionally garnish with lemon slice.

name: Lynchburg Lemonade
image: Lynchburg Lemonade, Grindhouse Killer Burgers, Atlanta GA.jpg
caption:
Lynchburg Lemonade
at Grindhouse Killer Burgers
prep: Shake first 3 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. Top with the lemonade or lemon-lime. Add ice and stir. Garnish with lemon slices and cherries.

name: Mai Tai
garnish: pineapple spear, mint leaves, and lime peel
prep: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a double rocks glass or a highball glass.
notes: The Martinique molasses rum used by Trader Vic was not an Agricole rum but a type of “rummy” from molasses.

name: Macuá
caption: Frozen Macuá made with [[Flor de Caña]] extra dry brand.
ingredients: 2 parts white rum (preferably Flor de Caña)
prep: Blend the ingredients with 1 cup of ice and serve well chilled. Garnish with an orange slice

name: Manhattan
caption: A classic 2:1 Manhattan, made with a whisky, sweet vermouth, bitters and a cherry
prep: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
notes: Garnish with a cocktail cherry.

name: Dry Martini
caption: The martini is one of the most widely known cocktails

name: Margarita
prep: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Mickey Slim
prep: Stir the DDT into the gin and serve

name: Mimosa
image: Pool-side Mimosas at The Standard Hotel.jpg
caption: Two Mimosas
prep: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

name: Mojito
garnish: sprig of mint, slice of lime
ingredients: 2 teaspoons white cane sugar (or 2 cl of sugar syrup)
prep: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Light stir to involve all ingredients. Garnish with sprig of mint leaves and lime slice.

name: Monkey Gland
prep: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Moscow mule
caption: Moscow mule as served at Rye, [[San Francisco]]
prep: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

name: Old Etonian
ingredients: 1.5 oz. Kina Lillet or Cocchi Americano
prep: Shake with ice and strain into a stemmed cocktail glass.

name: Orange Tundra
other: cream soda, coffee liqueur and orange juice
prep: add vodka, cream soda, coffee liqueur then orange juice to a highball class
notes: serve without stirring
primary_alcohol: cream soda, coffee liqueur and orange juice

name: Old fashioned
garnish: Orange twist or zest, and cocktail cherry
prep: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitter, add few dashes of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Stir gently. Garnish with orange twist or zest, and a cocktail cherry.

name: Negroni
caption: A Negroni
prep: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

name: Paloma
prep: Pour the tequila into a highball glass, squeeze the lime juice. Add ice and salt, fill up pink grapefruit soda. Stir gently.

name: Orgasm
prep: Build all ingredients over ice in an old fashioned glass or shot glass.

name: Painkiller
caption: A Painkiller and a bottle of Pussers
prep: Shake and garnish.

name: Paradise
prep: Shake together over ice.  Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

name: Pisco Sour
caption: Peruvian pisco sour
ingredients: Several drops of aromatic bitters at the end
prep: Vigorously shake contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then strain into a glass and garnish with bitters.{{sfn|Kosmas|Zaric|2010|p

name: Piña Colada
prep: Blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender, pour into a large goblet or Hurricane glass and serve.

name: Pisco Sour
caption: Peruvian pisco sour
ingredients: Several drops of aromatic bitters at the end
prep: Vigorously shake contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then strain into a glass and garnish with bitters.{{sfn|Kosmas|Zaric|2010|p

name: Porto Flip
prep: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice.  Strain into glass, garnish and serve

name: Polar Bear
image: Polar Bear cocktail, Empire State South, Atlanta GA.jpg
caption: Polar Bear cocktail
served: blended, on the rocks or neat
footnotes:
[http://www.drinksmixer.com/drink602.html Classic Polar Bear recipe] at DrinksMixer.com
}}

name: Platinum Blonde
prep: Combine ingredients with ice in cocktail shaker; shake well, then strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with rosemary sprig.

name: Queens
prep: Shake all ingredients in an ice-filled cocktail shaker. Strain into chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Quick Fuck
prep: *Pour Kahlua into shot glass*Layer Midori on top. *Carefully add Baileys, letting it float on top to finish.

name: Punch
caption: Southern [[Bourbon whiskey|Bourbon]] punch
drinkware: Often served in a punch bowl with punch glasses.
ingredients: Usually fruit juices and other drink mixers
prep: Varied

name: Redheaded slut
prep: Combine Jägermeister and schnapps in glass full of ice. Add cranberry juice to fill to top. Stir as necessary.
notes: May also be served as a [[Mixed drink shooters and drink shots|shooter]] – chilled and shaken, without ice

name: Red Russian
prep: Pour vodka, then Cherry Heering over ice.

name: Rickey
ingredients: Half of a lime squeezed and dropped in the glass
prep: Combine spirit, lime and shell in a highball or wine glass. Add ice, stir and then add sparkling mineral water.

name: 151 Swizzle
ingredients: 6 drops (1/8 tsp) of Pastis, herbsaint, or absinthe
prep:
Fill half a tall glass with crushed ice. Add all ingredients and swizzle (or stir with a long spoon) until ice forms on the outside of the glass (approx 8-10 seconds). Top with additional crushed ice.

'''''Alternative''''': Combine liquid ingredients and crushed ice in blender, blend on high 5 seconds. Pour into frosty pre-chilled metallic or tiki mug. Garnish with grated nutmeg and cinnamon stick.

name: Rusty Nail
prep: Pour all ingredients directly into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

name: Salmiakki Koskenkorva
prep: Premixed cocktail

image: Sake bomb - man pounds table with fist.jpg
prep: The shot of sake is dropped into the beer, causing it to fizz violently.  The drink should then be consumed immediately.
name: Sake bomb
Sazerac
caption: A Sazerac at the Sazerac Bar, [[The Roosevelt New Orleans Hotel]]
prep: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

name: Salty dog
prep: Shake gin and grapefruit juice in cocktail shaker. Strain into a salt-rimmed highball glass.

name: Screwdriver
image: Screwdriver, Birmingham-Shuttlesworth International Airport, Birmingham AL.jpg
caption: Screwdriver
prep: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

name: Sea Breeze
caption: Sea Breeze
prep: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Sidecar
prep: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Classic Singapore Sling
prep: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass or tumbler. Optionally add one or two ice cubes circa 2 cl - do not flood the drink with ice. Garnish with lemon slice and cocktail cherry.

name: Snakebite
prep: Mix in a standard pint glass equal parts lager and cider

name: Sours
caption: A whiskey sour garnished with a wheel of lemon and maraschino cherries.
notes: See the article for specifics.

name: Springbokkie
prep: The Crème de menthe is poured into the shot glass and the Amarula is carefully layered on top.

name: Stinger
caption: Stinger cocktail served over ice in a rocks glass
prep: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.
notes: It has been suggested that during the 1920s the Stinger ceased being an after-dinner cocktail, and instead should be consumed before dinner.{{sfn|Wondrich|2015|page

name: Tamagozake
ingredients: One raw egg (or egg yolk only)
prep: Whisk the raw egg yolk and honey/sugar into 3/4 cup hot sake (hot enough to lightly cook the egg – 1:30 in the microwave).
notes:
An alternative preparation method is to heat the sake/egg/honey mixture together, while whisking occasionally.
Be careful to stop cooking before it turns into scrambled eggs.

name: Suffering Bastard
prep: Shake everything but ginger beer with ice, pour unstrained into glass, top with ginger beer.

name: Tequila Slam/Coscorron
ingredients: One part 7 Up, ginger ale, Sprite, or Mountain Dew
prep: Mix carefully to avoid releasing the dissolved CO<sub>2</sub>.
notes: Variation — If [[champagne (wine)|champagne]] is used instead of soda pop, the drink is known as a '''Slammer Royale'''<ref> {{cite web|url

name: Tequila sunrise
caption: A tequila sunrise demonstrating its resemblance to a sunrise, in a stemware rather than the usual collins glass
prep: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice.  Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom.  Stir gently to create the sunrise effect.  Garnish and serve.

name: Juan Collins
ingredients: 1/2 ounce agave nectar (or 1 tsp. superfine sugar or 3/4 oz. cane syrup)
prep: Pour the tequila, lemon juice, and nectar into a collins glass over ice, stir. Add splash of club soda and garnish with lime and cherry.<ref>{{cite web | url

name: Tommy's margarita
caption: Tommy's margarita as it is served at Tommy's
prep: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Tuxedo
prep: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.  Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

name: Toronto
caption: Toronto cocktail served on the rocks

name: Up to Date
prep: Add sherry, rye whiskey, mariner, and bitters to a mixing glass with ice. Stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled glass, garnish with a lemon twist.
notes: For a sweeter cocktail, substitute dry sherry with sweet sherry and rye whiskey with [[Bourbon whiskey|bourbon]].<ref>{{Cite web|url

name: Vampiro
caption: Vampiro cocktail in a [[highball glass]], garnished with a slice of an [[Orange (fruit)|orange]] and a [[chili pepper]].
garnish: Salt on the rim. Chili pepper (optional)
ingredients: Few slices fresh red hot chili pepper
prep: Pour ingredients into glass rimmed with salt. Stir.

name: Vesper
prep: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
footnotes:
[[Cocktail glass]]es are commonly used instead of Champagne goblets in modern versions of this drink. Lillet Blanc should be substituted with Cocchi Americano for a closer approximation of the original cocktail.
}}

name: Tequila sunrise
caption: A tequila sunrise demonstrating its resemblance to a sunrise, in a stemware rather than the usual collins glass
prep: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice.  Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom.  Stir gently to create the sunrise effect.  Garnish and serve.

name: Vodka tonic
garnish: citrus fruit, usually lime or lemon
ingredients: One to three parts tonic water, to taste
Often lemon or lime juice fresh-squeezed from a wedge of fruit
prep: Mix and serve-stirred, not shaken.

name: Vieux Carré
caption: Vieux Carré
prep: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: White Lady
image: White Lady - Beefeater gin, Cointreau, fresh lemon juice (12403540403).jpg
prep: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.
notes: This cocktail is a variant of the [[Sidecar (cocktail)|Sidecar]]

name: Yorsh
ingredients: 1 part vodka (Ratio varies according to taste.)
prep: Mix thoroughly and drink quickly.

name: White Russian
caption: A mixed White Russian
prep: Pour coffee liqueur and vodka into an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Float fresh cream on top and stir slowly.

name: Whiskey Sour
caption: A whiskey sour with ice cubes and a lemon slice
served: On the rocks or straight up
garnish: Maraschino cherry and half orange slice
prep: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.
notes: If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Yellow Bird
prep: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass
